name: Crystal Sunrise Queen Luxury Resort & SPA

reviews.text: Very good resort. Food very good. Active entertainment. Good service. Polite staff.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I would like to come back again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great holiday at this hotel, 2 adults and 2 children (16 & 13), travelling with Thomas Cook in August 2011.
reviews.title: 5 star service at a 5 star all inclusive hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Going to start with the few minor niggles and get them out of the way - We asked for 2 rooms next to each other which granted the travel agent said they could not guarantee it they did say they would do their best. Upon checking in rooms were not next to each other and they made a big thing about saying that they had needed to upgrade one of the rooms so that we could at least be on the same floor! This resulted in us having a 'girls' room and a 'boys' room for the holiday as I was not prepared to leave the children on their own further down the landing. Air conditioning system in the hotel is poor, the inside public areas are very humid and despite having our air conditioning on in the room for 24 hrs on the coolest setting is was never cold. Final moan - people smoking. The hotel does not permit smoking inside but everywhere else smoking is allowed. In the main restaurant there are 2 small NO SMOKING parts but everywhere else people smoke. You could be sat by the pool, on the beach, eating your lunch/dinner or in one of the many bars and be surrounded by smokers. We had to leave one of the bars one night as it reminded me of what pubs used to be like in the UK before the ban - horrible. The hotel should designate smoking areas and not allow it when people are eating/drinking.
reviews.title: we felt great, but the hotel needs improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So moaning over, what are the plus points of the hotel? The complex is vast, split over many levels with a great beach at the bottom. There are several swimming pools with loads of sun beds and shade, and the kids pool at the new family block with the water slides is excellent.
reviews.title: Very impressed and will be going back

reviews.text: This was my second visit, we came initially in March. I joined my family who arrived a week before me. When they arrived their room had a pull out bed which was soiled, and the drinks in the mini bar had been half drunk. Staff did replace the bed and that was sorted.
reviews.title: Return Visit- Great Hotel

reviews.text: The location is excellent- near beach, a short walk to shops and Side. I had no complaints about then buffet food- best to dine early. We tried the Mexican, italian, Turkish, and fish alacarte. The italian and fish being the best. Book early through guest relations, not on the computer. Our favourite restaurant was he Phaselis near the beach where we had lunch every day.It is waiter service, and was never busy. Much better than the buffet.
reviews.title: Not as good as the first time

reviews.text: We never had problems with sunbeds.There were security guards around the pool until 8am. Anyone putting towels out before that had them removed!
reviews.title: Lovely holiday after a bad start

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had afternoon drinks in the Sunset Bar which has great views of the beach area. Service there was a bit hit and miss.Once we had to wait 30 minutes for our drink order to be taken. A few times we went up to the bar and got our own. This is not the fault of the staff, it is a management problem re understraffing at peak times .
reviews.title: THOMSON ISSUES BUT EXCELLENT HOTEL BUT HUGE

reviews.text: I saw bar staff in the reception area serving alcohol to underagers a few times-this being despite all children wear armbands showing they are underage.
reviews.title: Holidays are what you make them & our's was FAB FAB FAB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had read some of the recent reviews before my holiday I would have been very worried indeed!
reviews.title: A lovely place to watch the sunset

reviews.text: There are a few issues which could be bettered (as with pretty much anywhere you stay) however The Sunrise Queen is a lovely hotel and it would be difficult to have a totally bad holiday here in my opinion.
reviews.title: I never thought there were hotels as amazing quality as this one in turkey

reviews.text: Perhaps we were lucky in not staying in the family block, where most of the complaints seem to centre, but initially things were not all they could have been. We arrived at 3a.m. and were shown to a room in the basement area which was dark, musty smelling and had no balcony - just an opening onto one of the walkways. Added to this the fridge didn't work and the enormous coffee table took up most of the available space! There was a puddle of water in the corridor outside which the bellboy waded through to open our door. Not a good start for a 5* hotel! We were disappointed but pretty tired so decided to go to sleep and sort things out in the morning.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.text: After this however things looked up. We spoke to Kat (Thomas Cook rep) after her welcome meeting and she arranged another room for us on the 4th floor with a partial sea/mountain view. This room was 100% better, modern, bright and cheerful. There was no probem with the exchange, in fact the hotel reception asked us to view the room first and decide if it was OK. The only downside was the policy of the hotel to turn the aircon off at 2a.m. until 6a.m. every morning. Perhaps they think that guests are asleep and won't notice but we tended to wake up around 3a.m. when the heat started to kick in again (Turkey is very hot in August - daytime temperatures of around 40 degrees every day!). This is something we mentioned on our evaluation sheet. The gym is also not airconditioned - a bad mistake as it doesn't get used.
reviews.title: Good break but disappointing service

reviews.text: Our maid was lovely - a cheerful, friendly lady who did a wonderful job and even brought us a kettle and tea/coffee making facilities when she noticed my husband making his way back with cups of tea at 8a.m. every day! In fact all the staff were friendly and accomodating, we didn't find language a barrier - perhaps it depends on how you approach them, we did notice some people being quite offhand and rude to the staff, in which case you can't really expect them to put themselves out for you.
reviews.title: Poor service for a lovely hotel

reviews.text: we have just retured from our 10day holiday both me and my husband, this was our sixth visit at this fabulous hotel, side is a beautiful resort but we return to crystal sunrise hotel each year beacause we truely feel there is nowhere else like it. the staff are all so helpfull pleasent, the food well choice upon choice and presentation and quaility is second to none.
reviews.title: this hotel just gets better and better. what an amazing hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the entertainment side had struggled in previous years but this year they have got that in one they work so hard in preparing top shows and this is as well as doing something all day trying to entertain each and everyone but this is done without it being in your face. it does'nt matter which bar or restaurant you visit at crystal the staff are really quick, efficiant, pleasent, i could go on but i would run out of things to say. in one word the whole holiday is perfection true 5 star quality.
reviews.title: Returned again this year for our Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Returned to the Sunrise Crystal Queen again this year for our honeymoon. Last year we were impressed with the hotel this year it was even better. Huge refurbishment to the waterfall restaurant very impressive, the beach bar was almost completed before we left last year it is a big asset. The bowling alley and games and internet room were impressive to with all the lastest facilities and fast internet. The food last year was exceptional this year even better. we attended the return visitors meal which was an excellent evening it is nice that the hotel acknowledges return guests. We were treated like celebs this year as it was our honeymoon, we had champagne fruit and cakes in our room, and when we visited the al a carte italian restaurant we had another bottle of champagne and the chef had made us a cake with candles on to celebrate our honeymoon. One sign of a good hotel is the staff, and it was so nice that most of the staff from last year are still there. The turkish people have amazing memories they see thousands of tourists all year yet they still all remembered us which was really nice. I love the way Ali Ucas the General Manager operates, he walks round the hotel like a tourist, wherever you go he seems to be there, he eats in the restaurants and just mingles in which is brilliant. Nothing deters the staff, one morning all the tables were laid outside for breakfast and it started to rain, within 15minutes the staff had transferred everyone to an indoor restaurant with no fuss whatsoever. We hope to return to the Sunrise Queen again next year for our anniversary, we are frightened to go anywhere else because how can you better perfection!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sunrise Queen in August for 2 weeks. We had a fabulous time and we cannot really fault very much.It was our Silver Wedding Anniversary while we were away and a quick email to the hotel before we left secured us a beautifully decorated table in the mexican with 2 bottles of Champagne thrown in.We ate in all the a la carte restaurants and found them to be very good.The food in the main buffet restaurants were very good,plenty of choice and a very high standard.At lunchtime the Waterfall and the little restaurant by the beach with the food cooked to order were great.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not 5 star

reviews.text: The beach was lovely always plenty of sunbeds.Beware of the rocks in the water.We did not use the pools much as the sunbeds were always reserved early!!.And the adult only pool often had children there.These are my only criticisms of this area.
reviews.title: No less than 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The choice of food is excellent. The main buffet restaurant is very good with massive choice breakfast and dinner. Yes after 14 days there is bound to be repetition but the speciality nights are great. If you are vegi then you may struggle as I guess there is only so much vegetable gratin you can face! Although the cold buffet is also extensive. We tried the Italian and Mexican 'a la carte' and found the meals excellent. The waterfall restaurant for lunch is very good (buffet) but our favourite was the a la carte lunch restaurant - not a massive choice but all food is cooked fresh and you must try the Turkish flat bread. Was never really busy and was lovely to sit under the trees in the shade, enjoy a beautiful lunch and watch the world go by.
reviews.title: Great holiday, unforgettable memories...

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is truely excellent. We had a wonderful time last year and it didn't disappoint us on our return as they had made even more improvements to the hotel. As a family with 2 older children (mid 20's) there is plenty to keep everyone happy at this hotel. On our arrival all of the staff were friendly and welcoming and our room was spacious and clean. The week was fabulous thanks to the animation team who provided light hearted entertainment during the day time next to the pool and a variety of performances at night. The team was friendly and got us involved in aqua aerobics and other things to keep us occupied. Whilst offering excellent entertainment, there was also an adult only pool for times when you wanted a quieter few hours. The pool areas, as are all the other areas of the hotel were clean and tidy, we had no problems getting sunbeds or umbrellas which is always a relief. As a picky family when it comes to the food, we had nothing to complain about... the food was tasty and had a great selection in the buffets (the lunch time buffet area had been improved since last year with building works). During our stay we visited 3 of the A la carte restuarants - the turkish, the mexican and the fish restuarants - all had fantastic food and the service was outstanding. We also attended a returning guest dinner which was absolutely brilliant, the food was phenomenal and it was nice to see the managers of the hotel mixing with the guests. All of the staff across the hotel made such an effort and their English was extremely good, many of the staff had remembered us from the previous year so it was great to see so many familiar and friendly faces ! The hotel itself is beautifully maintained and sits in a lovely spot overlooking the sea, the way it is terraced allows you to see the sea from every bar and restuarant or whilst sitting in a quiet garden spot. Each bar had a wide selection of drinks available and the effort that went into making each cocktail was lovely. With it being a short walk into Side (walking very slowly it took approximately 45 minutes along the beautiful promenade at the sea front), it is perfect for a walk in late at night when it is slightly cooler! There is a family area which is hidden away from the main hotel which keeps small children away from the main areas. We have had the most fantastic holiday and found it very difficult to leave, without any doubt we will be returning next year!
reviews.title: 2nd time here and even better than last time!

reviews.text: If one of your main aims on your holidays is to get away from the kids then don't be fooled by the adult only pool at this hotel. At the adult only pool right now and there is 4-5 kids in the pool. Apparently it is okay as long as they are quiet!
reviews.title: Adult pool

reviews.text: This Hotel is not a 5* hotel. We stayed at the Trendy Aspendos Hotel (about 10 minutes away from the Sunrise Queen) last year and although it was full of German holiday makers (who I have to say were no problem at all) it was a true reflection of what a 5* hotel should be and what a paying customer should expect. If you get told that this is a Turkish 5* then please go and have a look at other 5* hotels in the surrounding area to make a fair comparison. For me, this is nearer to a 3* hotel.
reviews.title: Do not expect 5* from this hotel.

reviews.text: Accommodation
reviews.title: Excellent quality and service

reviews.text: We stayed in the brand new Family Block which now appears to be falling down or slipping on one side. We stayed in a basement room for 2 nights before we were moved for the following reasons, the room was "underground", no natural light looking up to the pathway/garden, the room was very damp and the floor was dangerously wet, the duvet, bed linen and our clothes were damp, the aircon was restricted to 22 which did not help the damp situation, the door to our room malfunctioned, locking us out on numerous occasions. We were given a manual key to unlock the door instead. The real problem was the fact that the hotel has "moved" so much that the door no longer fits in the frame correctly, family room without a bath! How are you supposed to bathe a toddler in a shower??, the walls were riddled with damp patches, sprinklers wake you up at about 03:30-04:00 in the morning if you are staying in one of the basement rooms. The water will crash against the patio window!!
reviews.title: Expensive for just being ok!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Sunrise Queen for 2 weeks September to October, went with family, all adults. On first impression on arrrival the Hotel is beautiful, long driveway up to the doors, and lovely reception area.
reviews.title: LOVELY HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice, we had sea view rooms and the balconies are very large, the rooms are clean and although we were in the same room types on the same floor, our bathrooms were different, one of the rooms obviously re-decorated with a new suite. Wallpaper lifting in places, so could do with a bit of a decorate, but not enough to spoil holiday.
reviews.title: 4 weeks of Crystal Sunrise Queen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air-con wasn't too good, it kept it a bearable heat but I would have liked it to be much colder.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was really good for an All Inclusive lots of choice and we couldn't complain about that. It was on the other hand sometimes hard to get a table! We had to walk around and around to find a table and sometimes the waiters didnt even attempt to put a clean cloth on the one we sat at, with new cutlery, we think that might have been because sometimes it was 8.30 ish and as previous people have said they are trying to clear up! we found that strange. The buffet at lunch was plentiful as well, also the sit down near the beach.
reviews.title: Most Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: The Sunbeds was the biggest annoyance of the holiday!
reviews.title: 3 Star hotel that thinks and charges 5 Star prices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we have been to this hotel and they have made some good improvements with the waterfall restaurant, for lunch times and the beach bar. The hotel covers a very vast site and we was always discovering something new. The food throughout the day is first class with plenty of choice. The only problem with all restaurants is the amount of people who are unable to go for an hour without smoking. The a la carte nights are good and also was nice to be invited to the returning guest meal, which again the food was fantastic. The staff are polite but assume that all there customers are German. The first room we had in the family block was on the lower ground floor which had signs of damp on the walls. When we complained they moved us the following day to the 4th floor. The swimming pools are good. The beach is vast with plenty of sunbeds and parasols (which were needed as temperatures reached 45). Would recommend without hesitation.
reviews.title: Good 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited the Crystal Sunrise Queen at the end of June through to the beginning of July with my boyfriend. I have visited the hotel many times and have enjoyed it every time. It's a lovely hotel in great location, right on top of the beach. Most of the staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough to help you, the staff at the front desk and recpetion were very helpful in sorting any issues we had. Atilla was always more than happy to help a long with the manager Ali Ucas and his team.
reviews.title: Brilliant Holiday!!

reviews.text: When visiting the pools everyday we always managed to find sunbeds, there was never a struggle for them, which was ideal. The grounds were well kept and clean as well as the hotel. Rooms were cleaned everyday by the very friendly maids.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited all the A la Carte restaurants apart from the Seafood, we found the service and the food the most enjoyable at the Italian restaurant. Food in the main restaurants was very nice with a variety each morning and evening. For lunch we found the little restaurant by the beach very nice as it was less busy and you could order from a varied menu.
reviews.title: special hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One problem we did find was the smoking, although the inside of the hotel was a smoke-free zone, everywhere outside you were allowed to smoke and therefore found wherever we were, we were having to breath in smoke fumes. Maybe it would be an idea to have more smoke-free zones around outside.
reviews.title: Well deserved 5 Star rating

aka: Crystal Sunrise Queen Luxury Resort And Spa
description: Named after the crystal clear waters of the Mediterranean, our hotel is constructed directly on the beach of Side-Kumkoy and is located only at 65 km from the Antalya International Airport, and at 70 km from the city center of Antalya. With its different architecture and the extraordinary beauty of the environment, our hotel is indeed a paradise for couples of all ages and families with children – offering a private fine sandy beach of 180 m length and 50 m width as well as a variety of pools.
